titles.title: Jesus The Very Thought Of Thee

authors.author: Bernard Of Clairvaux Edward Caswall John B. Dykes

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: Jesus, the very thought of Thee, newline With sweetness fills my breast; newline But sweeter far Thy face to see, newline And in Thy presence rest.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: No voice can sing, no heart can frame, newline Nor can the memory find newline A sweeter sound than Thy blest name; newline O Savior of mankind!

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: O Hope of every contrite heart, newline O Joy of all the meek; newline To those who fall, how kind Thou art! newline How good to those who seek!

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: But what to those who find? newline Ah, this no tongue or pen can show; newline The love of Jesus, what it is newline None but His loved ones know.

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: Jesu, our only joy be Thou, newline As Thou our prize wilt be; newline Jesus, be Thou our Glory now, newline And thru eternity. newline Amen.
